website_summaries.verdict: Very simple and easy to operate with bright and clear LED beam, and a well-focused glass lens.
pros: Fiberoptic LED otoscope, LEDs last much longer compared to standard bulbs, so longevity is fantastic
Comes with plenty of disposable specula and a neat carrying case
cons: Users report some components not staying connected

customer_reviews.title: High-end utility inexpensive otoscope.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Welsh-Allen diagnostic kit for work and I bought the RA Bock otoscope for my home...I can see more with the Bock because it uses an LED for illumination rather than the halogen that the WA uses. I was gratified that I could use the standard bayonet cones. You can't use a bulb insufflator with this and I think that's just as well. I have never found determining the mobility of the TM to be clinically useful . A few weeks ago I bought the Bock cardiology stethoscope. I am very happy with these products. It surprises me to learn that Bock has only 7 employees...
customer_reviews.author: John C. Bendheim, M.D.Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these units and neither has let me down. My largest concern when I purchased these was they are powered by C batteries. This should not be a concern at all. The batteries in each unit have lasted over two years of daily use. Other brands use a rechargeable batteries and are very expensive to replace when they stop charging. Is the fit and finsh as good as Welch? No, but they work and are durable and are the best bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A gave this as a gift to my best friend's daughter
customer_reviews.text: A gave this as a gift to my best friend's daughter. Her 2 young sons seem to have ongoing ear infections. She's thrilled to be able to look at their ears before calling for a doctors appointment.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: A Gift For My Wife
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas Gift for my Wife who is a Nurse Practitioner. She had one at work, but not at home to check our families ears. I think she is very satisfied with it. I cautioned her that the LED may but off a different color of light than what she was used to seeing, which she said it did, but she said it worked fine, and she loved the idea of not having to replace the bulb which is a constant problem about everywhere she has worked. So far she hasn't really used it enough to give it an actual "Working" rating, but for now we will give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Warden

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for medical school, and it didn't work when I got it. So I decided to try again. I sent this one back and ordered another one. The second one came very quickly, sooner than expected, and it works great! This is perfect for my clinical rotations. There wasn't any problem returning the defective otoscope and getting a refund. This company was great to work with!
customer_reviews.author: J. Alder

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional otoscope
customer_reviews.text: This lightweight otoscope provides clear visualization of the canal and TM. The light is bright. The handle size is comfortable. The case offers protection from dust and dirt, and is roomy enough for a sleeve of disposable probe covers. As an adult nurse practitioner, my use includes clinical evaluations for residents in a long term care facility and pre-employment physical exams. This otoscope meets the needs of my practice well. Absolutely would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: PBV

customer_reviews.title: It's not that great. It's doable when you are using at home ...
customer_reviews.text: It's not that great. It's doable when you are using at home and sometimes the light is too bright that it doesn't show the severity of the ear infection
customer_reviews.author: rsvt

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I'm a student nurse practitioner. Purchased this for a Mission's trip where we would be interacting with and seeing many pediatric patients. Works really well, battery life was good. Wish it would come with more speculums, however the ones it comes with fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Loreta Padron

customer_reviews.title: Otoscope for Manufacturing Inspection.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third unit I have bought for inspection downhole visual verification. The C battery makes the lighting last longer. The eye piece is standard size allowing eazy use. I used to buy Welch Allen versions at 3 to 4 times the cost. I like the LED lighting instead of halogen, and the metal housing for durability. The third unit does have a concern on the threading of the battery housing. . Keep on working on the quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Burt Tanaka

customer_reviews.title: Defective Scope
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this scope has never worked. I believe the light was out when we received it.
customer_reviews.author: scel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use otoscope
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, when you need to look into someone's ear. Comes with a set of extra 'tubes' for separate usage per person. Lighting is adequate and the otoscope feels good in the hand. Take out the batteries when not in use to prevent them from leaking and shut off the light when not using to prevent the batteries to run on empty too quickly. Of course, never try to play your own doctor, when you are not! It is no toy for children either!
customer_reviews.author: Maria T. Sindram

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully
customer_reviews.text: Works beautifully, I can see just as well if i was using an Allen welch otoscope . Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great piece for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I have a toddler with chronic ear infections and friends that are doctors who come by regularly. They don't carry an otoscope around with them so I decided to get one to keep here for them to use. I researched a lot of these and didn't want I spend the big bucks for a welch alyn pro model so I decided to try this one. I was pleasantly surprised and the quality is very good for the price. Would highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great otoscope
customer_reviews.text: Nice white light. Took a while getting used to the focal length, I eventually realised I did not need to get as close to it, to see clearly, as with my old WA. Great otoscope, especially for the price. I can see more clearly than with my 2.5V WA. Standard specula fit, but sometimes with difficulty. I ordered some from the seller and those are fine.
customer_reviews.author: Denise M.

customer_reviews.title: Great price!  Good product.
customer_reviews.text: I really have no complaint with this otoscope except the specula just won't stay in place. Sometimes the light was a bit hard to focus, but for 90 bucks??? Sheez, it's still a steal! Because of the great price I felt that I would be able to replace it so I ended up giving it to a doc in the mission field in Nepal; he was extremely happy with it. I will certainly buy another one and hopefully will be able to figure out the trick to making the specula stay on. At this price, I can deal with removing them from the patient's ear every now and then.
customer_reviews.author: Mary LTRN

customer_reviews.title: Otoscope works fine; very
customer_reviews.text: wanted it to use on my dog but the cones are too short. Otoscope works fine; very bright
customer_reviews.author: bxsci71

customer_reviews.title: Good investment.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a cheaply made plastic ENT Otoscope Kit. This is so much better and is made to last. The LED is just the right brightness and doesn't drain the batteries. The optics are clear and anatomy is easily viewed.
customer_reviews.author: Hexum944

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a good thing to have for any first aid kit. The quality is good, and the fact that it all fits neatly in a small case is nice as well. I like how the light turn on and off by turning the collar on the handle. The light is adequate enough to see inside of the ear. I am glad I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: C2Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Better than the professional office models!
customer_reviews.text: I am a nurse practitioner and use otoscopes on a regular basis. I needed one for home use and this is, by far, better than the ones I have used in the office setting. The light is brighter. The tip is better shaped and I am completely satisfied. I wish I had this to use in my office, it would make my job easier. Maybe I should tell my boss that:)
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my granddaughter. I had a similar product for my own children 26 years ago! This is a professional grade instrument. Any mother can benefit from owning this. My own experience with an otoscope allowed me to check my children's ears for early signs of ear infections and seek treatment early. This, of course, shortened the duration of their illness and they suffered less! It is easy to use once you learn to use it correctly. Your can ask your pediatrician for help learning to use it if you need to.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Great for battery life, but turns off a lot.
customer_reviews.text: It isn't quite as bright as I had hoped, and unless I jiggle it just the right way, the connection goes and the light turns off. Annoying. On the other hand, I love not having to plug the rechargeable battery in every night.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Thwing

customer_reviews.title: Excellent otoscope for the cost!
customer_reviews.text: I love the way the specula go on - and STAY ON - and that they come in a container from which they can be retrieved without having to touch them. The light is nice and bright and the magnification is sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Grey

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed in the quality
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed in the quality. Light is not as bright as I had hoped. All in all pretty good value/
customer_reviews.author: Janet Mueller-Alsup

customer_reviews.title: Nursing quality
customer_reviews.text: I am an RN (ER/Outpatient) this is the same quality build and feel as a true medical grade instrument- slightly smaller. Well worth the cash. Both kids have tons-o-ear infections- this is nice to see whats up inside thier little ears, also could be used to see cerumen crap build up in loved ones ears as well.
customer_reviews.author: stephnjay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Works as needed and advertised. Have three kids and it helps me keep their ears clear and see what is going on with any concerns for ear infections.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I use this to look into my dogs' ears co I can clean them. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good. You can find cheaper ones that does the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: bucci215

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to give to a friend who was going on a medical missionary trip. She loved it and said it was high quality and very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Fringe Dweller

customer_reviews.title: Good for home use
customer_reviews.text: I'd read that some doctors had purchased one as a back up or for home use. The light is truly an asset, but I was disappointed after using my vet's otoscope. I like the LED bulb, which I believe is less expensive to replace than halogen.
customer_reviews.author: an

customer_reviews.title: Great Otoscope
customer_reviews.text: The Pro-Fiberoptic otoscope really fits the bill. For many years we used an otoscope that was used in a doctor's office. It finally hit the dust. I found the Pro-Fiberoptic on Amazon and made the purchase based on the reviews. I am not disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good starter kit
customer_reviews.text: I am a first year audiology student and I have found that this otoscope has met my current needs. The zippered case is a nice feature and the LED bulb is of good quality and I am yet to change the batteries or bulb. My only concern is how the instrument fits together. While dismantling the device to insert the batteries I had difficulty re-threading the caps and worried I was stripping the threads.
customer_reviews.author: millcait

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal
customer_reviews.text: You will be hard pressed to find a better deal for the money. Not to mention the quality view you achieve with this. Additionally the light intensity is variable, which is not in the description. Shipping was prompt and without error. I received mine early the next day which was exactly what I needed. EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.author: BearpawAZ

customer_reviews.title: Great item for price.
customer_reviews.text: Arrrived quickly, sturdy item, magnifier clear and bright white light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LED Otoscope
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. LED helps visualize the TM well. No complaints. I haven't used it long enough to test the battery longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Mllarnp

customer_reviews.title: Images that are just like what I see in the Dr's office
customer_reviews.text: I started with a plastic Dr Mom, then got the 4th Generation Dr Mom... and once I viewed an ear with the one in my Dr's office I went out and got this one. With this Pro-Fiberoptic LED Otoscope I am able to see the ear just like what I see using my Dr's Otoscope. This is balanced correctly, has the right magnification and correct focal length. Great Otoscope!
customer_reviews.author: Richard N. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fiber optics illumination very nice and the CRI of the LED light source is more than sufficient in rendering skin tones (red). I would give the construction quality a 7/10 with Welch Allen Otoscopes being a 10/10, but for the price and the quality of the LED I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. M.

customer_reviews.title: Quality control is apparently really bad
customer_reviews.text: Waited a good 4 days to recieve the Otoscope so I could monitor an ear infection in my youngest daughters ear, only to be dissappointed when the Otoscope arrived. The machined threads that connect the battery body to the fiberoptic scope end, were machined to 2 different thread sizes. Trying to return the item now. Think I would be better off just continuing to use my L.E.D. flashlight and the magnifying glass on my Swiss Army knife (I can count on the quality of these 2 items).
customer_reviews.author: dan chase

customer_reviews.title: Good quality & good price
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this an excellent otoscope, but it rivals Welch Allyn in quality while providing it for a very reasonable & affordable price. It is useful for physicians in training, in practice, or retired & want to be able to "check ears" for family. The product arrived on time with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Durocher MD

customer_reviews.title: L.E.D. Otoscope-great value
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a spare in our medical practice. It is of excellent quality for the price. Highly recommended otoscope <$100.
customer_reviews.author: NewEnglandLove

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Pro-Fiberoptic LED Otoscope has totally met my expectations. Absolutely love it! My son has had multiple ear infections since age 1 1/2 and had had tubes since. He's now 10. This devices has the perfect lighting and is easy to use. Compares to otoscopes used by ENT doctors. As a nurse, it gives me piece of mind that I can monitor my son's ears accurately between doctor visits.
customer_reviews.author: MBJShopper

customer_reviews.title: Professional grade, excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I paid twice that much for an otoscope of comparable quality 30 years ago. Excellent illumination, optimal magnification. I'm especially fond of the closed "pneumatic" head design; a couple of quick puffs via a piece of rubber tubing (not included, unfortunately) is still a good way to test for tympanic membrane mobility.
customer_reviews.author: Babydoc

customer_reviews.title: Fair price for quality. Little bulkier than what was ...
customer_reviews.text: Fair price for quality. Little bulkier than what was expected. Needed for Nursing School & purchased with 2-day shipping, but shipping date kept getting delayed. Almost had to cancel. Received almost 2 weeks later than scheduled.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J. Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: PRO fiber optic LED otoscope
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good otoscope for the price. I had a clear view and it was easy to use and is lightweight. A great addition to bring along on medical missions, as I have.
customer_reviews.author: ccp

customer_reviews.title: So far she is very pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my wife who is an NP. She wanted an otoscope for home use. So far she is very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: m76dressler

customer_reviews.title: Otoscope
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to our medical kit. Easy to use, well built and runs on C cell batteries. My wife used it to check my ears and said it is comparable to the expensive units she uses at the hospital.
customer_reviews.author: Marine Scout

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive otoscope.
customer_reviews.text: This otoscope performed very well for the price but was not as bright as I would have preferred. The batteries last forever given the low amount of energy needed to light the fiberoptics.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Webster

customer_reviews.title: Pro Led Otoscope
customer_reviews.text: After using a WA otoscope since the beginning of my career as a Physician Assistant, I was thrilled with the quality and the brightness of this scope. It is extremely portable in its carrying case. I would highly recommend this item to anyone in the Medical Profession. Sister Marie de Sales, SSND PA
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary T.ODowd

customer_reviews.title: Birthday gift for a nurse
customer_reviews.text: My sister is graduating nursing school soon and really wanted this otoscope. She is very happy with its quality and I was happy to get her something she really wanted.
customer_reviews.author: darren lisitza

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I have to wonder sometimes about negative reviews when a product works well and exactly as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Stacky

customer_reviews.title: Great scope!
customer_reviews.text: I received my otoscope in time and it is great! It is every thing I expected in an otoscope! The light is bright and I can see clearly.
customer_reviews.author: Hope N

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL and WOULD BUY AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful device!!!! I use it to look in my pets ears so I can see if I need to take them to the vet or if it is something I can do myself. Also works on looking to see if there is something under the skin. Would I buy it again???? YES. YES. YES. YES. YES!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Moore

customer_reviews.title: Cheap lens connection broke
customer_reviews.text: The device works well, but the magnification lens is attached with a cheap plastic hinge and it broke within a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: JB W.

customer_reviews.title: Best Otoscope next to a $400 Dr. version.
customer_reviews.text: I compared several Otoscopes, including Welch Allen, and this is what I decided on. This instrument is solid and appears to have the same quality of Allens. You can add a device to look into eyes if you like but they are expensive. The LED light will last for ever and is brighter than similar incandescents and the battery will last a lot longer. Highly recommend. This will either save you a trip to a doctor or get you there before things get more serious.
customer_reviews.author: Robin E. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: As a Physician Assistant, I wanted a reasonably priced otoscope for at home use to check my daughters ears, and this one does the job. Of course the light is not extremely strong, and the focus/clarity is not adjustable, but I am able to see enough to know whether we need a trip to the pediatrician, vs. just teething/fussiness/allergies. Definitely a good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi M. Siler

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: There was no way to adjust the lens. I purchased the ENT diagnostic kit instead and love it! The return process as always with amazon was easy as pie!
customer_reviews.author: DeAnne Monson

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It is lightweight. The bulb is bright and the ear peices are good. Good otoscope for the price and nice storage case.
customer_reviews.author: Clair E. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: On time delivery and good product for price. Recommend anytime!
customer_reviews.author: Darold Spillman

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It serves the purpose of a home otoscope quite well
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Ann Geden

customer_reviews.title: Earned My Appreciation
customer_reviews.text: This otoscope exceeded my expectations. It gives good visualization of the tempanic membrane and the light is bright. The company also exceeded my expectations with a fair price and prompt delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Tyrone Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Good instrument for work
customer_reviews.text: I`m a pediatrician. I`m from Argentina. This instrument is really usefull in my daily practice. I am pleased with the buying. I didn`t have any problem with it. I recomend it 100%. Excellent relation quality - price.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Good price but not as bright as I had hoped for
customer_reviews.text: Cheap enough but the light isn't that great. Let's be clear that this isn't a Welch Allen. It's perfect as an inexpensive home otoscope.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P. Wayock

customer_reviews.title: great otoscope
customer_reviews.text: this was a graduation gift for my daughter (from nursing school). She said it was very heavy-duty and worked unbelievably well.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brandt

customer_reviews.title: nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who has children could find this tool useful. I purchased this as a gift for my Son who has 3 children (two of who have ear wax problems) and he is pleased to be able to examine the problem and perhaps provide relief with a gentle ear syringe process rather than always needing to visit the doctors office. (unless they are running a temperature of course).
customer_reviews.author: C. Marcellin

customer_reviews.title: 100%reliable product
customer_reviews.text: As always reliable product. Had one for years which withstood rough use. Bought a new one when the old one was dropped and broke.
customer_reviews.author: RAJESH THAMPY

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: I am a pediatrician. I love it, it works well. Ear canal and TM easy to see, light works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent built
customer_reviews.text: The internal reflection could be better. Overll quality is good. The final cost x benefit is very good. I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Roaldo

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a good value. It works but is not great.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this otoscope for my mother (a nurse) and she is impressed with its quality and it works well enough. She uses it just for home (father is prone to ear infections, and we use it for another relative as well) and has been able to see everything she needs to see with it. Overall very happy with this otoscope. Surface cleaning should suffice for the specula unless someone has a very bad infection.
customer_reviews.author: P. S. Kiesling

customer_reviews.title: Great white LED light and durable.
customer_reviews.text: The white LED light stands this otoscope out. I have not found the halogen bulb scope easy to use since discovering this white LED scope. Great price too. the specula fall off soon after with repeated usage.
customer_reviews.author: amina

customer_reviews.title: malfunction at first, but they fixed it immediately
customer_reviews.text: I received otoscope that didn't work initially. The company immediately shipped me a simple, easy to install replacement part and it works fine now. Part of the reason I purchased this item is its lifetime warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Ann C. Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: The shipping was fairly quick. The otoscope is sturdy easy to use. I am pleased with the quality and it has done the job for me to see my daughters ears.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: LED lighting, swinging lens, professional materials/heavy-duty feel in your hand (yet reasonable weight, not a dumbbell like the Welch Allyn), and insufflation capable make this an excellent otoscope... and not to mention the incredibly fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Although it's no a Welch Allen, it is an affordable otoscope and works well. I use it for home use and if I had to use it everyday, then I would spend the money on a more expensive one.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Fober optic Otoscope
customer_reviews.text: I have used this so much already, it has been an excellent product, The fiber optic light puts out a lot of light, it is strong and sturdy. I see alot of patients and I have been exceptionally pleased with this.
customer_reviews.author: scrappy

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a family practice physician and was pleasantly surprised to note the quality of this otoscope for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Good medical device
customer_reviews.text: This otoscope is fine for use in an office or around the house. Light source was good. Not too heavy, not too light.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Loudon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love this Otoscope!!! The light is phenomenal! I was a little hesitant to buy this Otoscope but after reading the other reviews I gave it a shot and ordered it. I am happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. V. Burg

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our NP daughter to use. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Katone42

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: Im a practicing physician and needed something portable but reliable. It really delivers. You can definitely see the TMs clearly, good lighting and won't break your bank.
customer_reviews.author: Dr nikos

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic item
customer_reviews.text: Best one I have ever owned. Very portable due to light weight. Easy to use. Viewing field extremely well lit. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Kittredge

customer_reviews.title: Loved it.
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME product. Well worth the cost. Best Otoscope I have used. Love the case and that everything is self contained..
customer_reviews.author: verna rosso

customer_reviews.title: Quality not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Quality not what I expected for the price. the slim-line otoscope for moms is just as good for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Knight

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use; Great light
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a penlight otoscope that I'd used for years. It works great, light is strong and easy to see the eardrum.
customer_reviews.author: Merilee Payne

customer_reviews.title: I originally bought it based on other reviews and the price seemed good but I ended up buying the Welch Allyn Macroview ...
customer_reviews.text: It arrived broken and has a lot more plastic than I expected. I originally bought it based on other reviews and the price seemed good but I ended up buying the Welch Allyn Macroview Otoscope Head and LOVE it! Everyone in my class used my otoscope for the exams.
customer_reviews.author: E. Erickson

customer_reviews.title: PRO Otoscope
customer_reviews.text: I like the product but not customer service. Can't talk to anyone. Send an email instead -they require- and get an automated response which was NOT related to my question. Did this about four times.
customer_reviews.author: Kathie Carden-Kirby

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Broke 1 day after using it - either bulb malfunctioned or it's the connection. Tried new batteries - still doesn't work. Spend your money on a real set!
customer_reviews.author: John and Anne

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the quality of this product. It will work perfect for my practice needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this item!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend this otoscope. I should have known by the cheap price. The top part doesn't attach securely to the lower battery portion and easily comes apart.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly A Offhaus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Used it in Bonaire as a Diver Medic
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Used it in Bonaire as a Diver Medic. High quality. I could see a ruptured tympanic membrane on one of my divers. Durable.
customer_reviews.author: Eirik Kydland

customer_reviews.title: Otoscope did not work
customer_reviews.text: For the price I expected something that would help my daughter' career. She could not see into any ear with it. I think she returned it.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen henderson

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine but wasn't for me.
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine, it just wasn't for me. I found I couldn't get use to the light color and never felt that I could ID landmarks as well.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sort of a bluish hue to the light. Can't see squat with it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K. Pedersen

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product
customer_reviews.text: Product never worked, would not even stay together. Returned product and went with another brand
customer_reviews.author: R. Khalil

customer_reviews.title: Professional otoscope. Great quality
customer_reviews.text: My wife being a nurse was looking for a quality otoscope. This one is awesome, perfect amount of non-coloring light. If a unit changes the color of what’s being examined, a misdiagnosis may occur. This is a high end piece. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Scanzera

product_meta.title: RA Bock PRO Fiberoptic L.E.D. Otoscope with Zippered Leatherette Case
product_meta.description: Now need never contend with a burned-out otoscope bulb again! Prepare to be amazed at the clear, bright, unobstructed view it provides, using an LED Fiberoptic light source. Why LED? The energy efficiency and durability of this otoscope is unmatched especially when compare to Halogen light sources. The LED light source has no filament to break like a conventional incandescent powered otoscope. The LED bulb is shock resistant unlike halogen which is incandescent and contains a fragile filament. You will be amazed by the amount of light created by the LED bulb. The light produced by this otoscope is full spectrum white light and not the yellow light typically created by incandescent light bulbs on other otoscopes. With a light emitting diode there is no fragile filament to break so it can withstand repeated dropping or rough handling. The halogen bulbs found on other otoscopes burn very hot and eat battery power, they are also somewhat fragile, and can be broken when the otoscope is dropped or handled in any rough manner. The special halogen bulbs in some premier otoscopes cost up to forty dollars each, and aside from failing when dropped, they burn out after a time, just from ordinary usage. ***This Otoscope is also available with an Ophthalmoscope from our RA Bock website *** Before you purchase an otoscope visit the site www.Fakespot.com to to check for fake positive reviews. It definitely will be worth your while to know which companies are being honest and who is gaming the review system on Amazon.
